At Positive Wellbeing Association , our mission is to provide exceptional consulting services that empower our clients to achieve their business goals. We strive to deliver customized solutions that meet the unique needs of each client.
Our team consists of experienced consultants with diverse backgrounds in various industries. We combine our expertise to deliver innovative solutions to our clients.
We believe in a collaborative approach to consulting, where we work closely with our clients to understand their needs and develop solutions together. Our goal is to build long-lasting relationships with our clients.
Our team of experienced consultants will work with you to develop a solid business strategy that aligns with your goals and objectives. We'll help you identify opportunities for growth and create a plan to achieve success.
We understand that financial management is a crucial part of running a successful business. Our team will help you manage your finances, create budgets, and identify areas for cost-cutting and growth.
Our marketing experts will help you create a strong brand and develop effective marketing strategies to reach your target audience. We'll help you create engaging content and leverage social media to grow your business.
Our HR consultants will help you create a positive work environment, recruit and retain top talent, and develop performance management systems to ensure your team is working at their best.
We'll help you leverage the latest technology to to develop Positive Integrated Psychology Interventions to develop a Growth mindset. Our expertise Positive Psychology Practitioner offers a bespoked wellbeing research center .
Our consultants will help you identify and provide information upon student wellbeing. Furthermore a student wellbeing research paper has been published at the University of east London’s Teaching and learning symposium.

The Positive Wellbeing Association Journals mission is to provide a Growth mindset and to develop PIPI Positive Integrated Psychology Intervention.
Positive Intergrated Psychology Intervention for COVID-19.
Abstract
The sole purpose of the emergence of a Positive Integrated Psychology Intervention (PIPI) with the BRAMMT/PERMA model was to overcome extreme levels of stress with possible Psychological outcomes during COVID-19. The PIPI entailed the amalgamation of the BRAMMT model feeding into the PERMA model over a 8 week duration. The PIPI was implemented using the autoenthnography qualitative method to reflect upon cultural, political and social meaningful experiences of COVID-19. The Positive Integrated Psychology Intervention (PIPI) provided a Positive Well being Platform for the acquisition of Positive Adaptive flourishing behaviours to unravel. The PIPI was facilitated by the DAW hypothesis deepening and widening process allowing the Dual-system model to advocate the whole intervention within a systematic framework. The outcome was indeed very much a deepening and wideing experience with the reinforcment of experiences steering the Dual-system model of adaptation towards a notion of Optimal levels of human functioning.
KEYWORDS: Positive Integrated Psychology Intervention, Autoenthnography, DAW Hypothesis, COVID-19, BRAMMT, PERMA, Dual-System model of adaptation.
